image_copyright: © Mario Avati / Artists Rights Society (ARS), New York
provenance: The artist’s estate, Paris; his wife; Muriel Sterne, (her sister), Minnetonka, MN
text: French artist Mario Avati loved the contrast of black and white, especially when arrayed in patterns. Here he allows us to experience the visual confusion for which the zebra’s camouflage seems to have evolved. Mia has another example of this subject printed on red paper.
title: Six Running Zebras
